00001 // Mutex.cpp: implementation of the CMutex class.
00002 //
00004 
00005
00006 #include <System/ReentrantMutex.h>
00007 #include <System/SimpleException.h>
00008
00009 using namespace Omiscid;
00010
00012 // Construction/Destruction
00014 
00015 ReentrantMutex::ReentrantMutex()
00016 {
00017 #ifdef WIN32
00018     mutex = CreateMutex(NULL, false, NULL );
00019     #ifdef DEBUG
00020         OwnerId = 0;
00021     #endif
00022 #else
00023     pthread_mutexattr_t attr;
00024     pthread_mutexattr_init (&attr);
00025     pthread_mutexattr_settype (&attr, PTHREAD_MUTEX_RECURSIVE);
00026     pthread_mutex_init (&mutex, &attr);
00027
00028     if(pthread_mutex_init(&mutex, &attr) != 0)
00029         throw  SimpleException("Error Mutex Init");
00030 #endif
00031 }
00032
00033 ReentrantMutex::~ReentrantMutex()
00034 {
00035 #ifdef WIN32
00036     if ( mutex )
00037     {
00038         CloseHandle( mutex );
00039     }
00040 #else
00041     pthread_mutex_destroy(&mutex);
00042 #endif
00043 }
00044
00045 bool ReentrantMutex::EnterMutex()
00046 {
00047 #ifdef WIN32
00048     unsigned int Result = WaitForSingleObject( mutex, INFINITE );
00049     if ( Result == WAIT_OBJECT_0 )
00050     {
00051 #ifdef DEBUG
00052         // In debug mode, set the owner id
00053         OwnerId = GetCurrentThreadId();
00054 #endif
00055         // Here we go, we've got the mutex
00056         return true;
00057     }
00058 #else
00059     if( pthread_mutex_lock(&mutex) == 0 )
00060     {
00061         return true;
00062     }
00063 #endif
00064 
00065     return false;
00066 }
00067
00068 bool ReentrantMutex::LeaveMutex()
00069 {
00070 #ifdef WIN32
00071     if ( !ReleaseMutex(mutex) )
00072     {
00073         return false;
00074     }
00075     #ifdef DEBUG
00076         OwnerId = 0;
00077     #endif
00078 
00079 #else
00080     if( pthread_mutex_unlock(&mutex) != 0 )
00081     {
00082         return false;
00083     }
00084 #endif
00085 
00086     return true;
00087 }
